intro: Hieracium tenuirhizodes, commonly known as slender-rooted hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and leaves that are usually lance-shaped, and its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium tenuirhizodes is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in certain regions.
